funding_info.funding_details: Full-cost scholarships to outstanding applicants from countries outside the UK to pursue a postgraduate degree in any subject available at the University of Cambridge. It provides a full-cost scholarship and living stipend for graduate study. Covers full tuition, living expenses, research and academic travel funding, flights to Cambridge, etc. Also provides additional, discretionary funding.

timeline_info.application_deadline: US citizens and currently resident in the United States must apply by 15 October. Deadline for all other eligible applicants: December 2, 2025, or January 7, 2026 – dependent on your course (see course directory). Please apply by the Course Funding Deadline referenced in the University Course Directory.
timeline_info.opening_date: Application cycle for 2026-2027 opens in early September of 2025. Applications are open for the Gates Cambridge Scholarship 2026-2027!
timeline_info.number_of_awards: c.80 full-cost scholarships

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding applicants from countries outside the UK (non-UK citizens). Must complete the section to apply for admission to a course and a College place and the Gates Cambridge part of the funding section. If currently studying at Cambridge and wish to apply for a new postgraduate course, you can apply. Current Gates Cambridge Scholars may also apply for a second scholarship if applying for a new degree. Cannot apply to fund the remainder of a course already started.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any subject available at the University of Cambridge

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 3.5 GPA (3.7 for first)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate degree (PhD, MSc, MPhil, or a one-year postgraduate)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Must meet the University of Cambridge's English language requirements, typically through IELTS or TOEFL scores. Proof of English language proficiency may be required depending on the course and applicant's background.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Be able to explain why you applied to Gates Cambridge in the context of your career trajectory.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Earlier round for applicants who are both US citizens and currently resident in the United States.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Outstanding intellectual ability, reasons for choice of course, a commitment to improving the lives of others, leadership potential, potential to succeed on the chosen course, and the potential for an academically transformative experience at Cambridge.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Transcripts, references, experience (as evidence of academic excellence)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Academic departments at the University of Cambridge nominate only the most academically outstanding applicants for a Gates Cambridge Scholarship.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 2000 by a donation of $210 million from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation to the University of Cambridge.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: There is an earlier round for applicants who are both US citizens and currently resident in the United States. The large majority of applicants will apply in the later round, which is aligned with the University’s postgraduate funding competition.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship that provides financial support to students undertaking a research degree. It provides a stipend and fee offset. Supported by the Australian Commonwealth Government and offered by the University of Melbourne to high-achieving domestic and international students.

timeline_info.application_deadline: October 31 (typically for consideration in the following year; current students must apply online by October 31, 2025, for consideration the next year)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 600+ scholarships annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: High-achieving domestic and international students enrolling in or already enrolled in a Masters by Research or Doctoral degree (PhD) at the University of Melbourne. Previous recipients of the University of Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarship are not eligible. Applicants must have some research experience.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any graduate research degree/program at the University of Melbourne (a number of courses offered by different Melbourne Schools).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Masters by Research or Doctoral (PhD) degree

experience_requirements.accepted_types: research experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English language proficiency (IELTS/TOEFL/Pearson Test of English Academic) is required to meet University entry requirements.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Previous recipients of the University of Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarship are not eligible to apply.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts and degree certificates, Proof of English language proficiency, Research proposal (if required by faculty), Updated CV.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: No separate application is required; applicants are automatically considered when applying for a graduate research course at the University of Melbourne. Offers are made separately but around the same time as course offers, based on academic merit.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Melbourne Research Scholarship (MRS) is offered alongside the Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarship to high-achieving domestic and international students undertaking a Masters by Research or Doctorate by Research degree at the University of Melbourne. It is supported by the Australian Commonwealth Government. Domestic students typically receive an RTP Scholarship (Fee Offset) with their course offer.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application deadline for the Melbourne Research Scholarship is typically October 31 for students who wish to be considered for the scholarship in the following year. Current students must apply online by October 31, 2025, for consideration the next year.

basic_info.official_name: University of Sydney Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded opportunity. Provides full tuition fees, a substantial annual stipend, and covers health insurance and living expenses.
covered_expenses: Substantial annual stipend of approximately AUD 40,109

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 1000 scholarships will be available each year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to both domestic and international students. Accepting applications from all nationals. For outstanding commencing and enrolled higher-degree by research (HDR) students.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Available across all research disciplines offered at the University of Sydney. Open to all academic fields.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Higher Degree by Research (HDR), Master's by Research, PhD

experience_requirements.min_years: 1.5 years full-time (for work experience to be counted)
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience, research papers, research experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Meet the University's English language requirements. This can be satisfied by: at least one year of full-time study (or part-time equivalent) in a recognised bachelor’s degree or other approved higher education qualifications, where the instruction for your studies (teaching, assessment and examination) was entirely in English in approved countries and/or institutions, assessed on a case-by-case basis by the University; or at least one year of full-time (or equivalent part-time) tertiary study in a recognised bachelor’s degree or other approved tertiary qualifications, within five years of the date on which you will commence your course, in one of the following English-speaking countries; or a three-year undergraduate degree, completed within five years of course commencement in which the language of instruction (teaching, assessment and examination) and the institution was English.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Ensure to tick the box to be considered for the RTP Scholarship. Applicants may be offered a conditional Scholarship without having yet received admission offer but will only receive a firm scholarship offer once they have received an unconditional admission offer.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Certificate of study, Two letters of recommendation, Research proposal, Motivation letter, A copy of the passport and a personal photo, Research Experience Evidence Template (RE Form)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarships are awarded to students of exceptional research potential. The Scholarship may be held for up to 14 research periods (full time) for Research Doctorate studies, or for up to 7 research periods for Research Masters.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The University of Sydney Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships are an esteemed, fully funded opportunity for both domestic and international students aiming to undertake a Higher Degree by Research (HDR) in Australia. This prestigious scholarship provides full tuition fees, a substantial annual stipend of approximately AUD 40,109, and covers health insurance and living expenses. It is open to all academic fields, empowering outstanding scholars to excel at one of the world’s top universities. Over 1000 scholarships are available each year, awarded annually in three rounds.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The official website mentions an 'Application and award timeline'. The RTP Scholarship at University of Sydney can be taken in any of three rounds awarded annually.

basic_info.provider: Commonwealth Scholarships Commission (CSC), UK Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office (FCDO), Department for International Development

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded PhD in the UK. The CSC provides the UK government scholarship scheme led by international development objectives.
covered_expenses: living allowance whilst you are in UK

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 800 scholarships and fellowships for postgraduate study and professional development are awarded annually by the CSC (this figure includes all types of CSC awards).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be from least developed countries and vulnerable states, as classified by the OECD Development Assistance Committee (DAC), in the Commonwealth. Candidates must be Commonwealth citizens. The CSC does not accept direct applications for these scholarships; candidates must apply through a nominating agency.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Research must fit one of six themes set by the Commonwealth, including examples such as 'Science and technology for development' and 'Strengthening health systems and capacity'.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Scholarships are for full-time doctoral study at an approved UK university or higher education institution for 36 months only. The funding only covers expenses for the time spent in the UK.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For PhD applicants, a 2nd Class lower Division in their 1st Degree is accepted (as per Nigerian Ministry of Education advertisement).
academic_requirements.required_degree: To start a PhD program, applicants may need to complete a Master's program first. However, for Nigerian applicants, a 2nd Class lower Division in their 1st Degree is accepted for PhD.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant professional experience may be required, especially for fellowships.

additional_requirements.gender_requirement: The CSC aims for widening access for women.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must have gotten at least two admissions from UK Universities. PhD candidates must attach a supporting statement from the UK University. Candidates must complete an application using the CSC’s online application system, in addition to any other application required to be completed by the nominating agency.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: A supporting statement from the UK University and a research proposal are required.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The scholarship selection process is based on academic merit, the quality of the research proposal, and potential development impact. The CSC invites around three times more nominations than scholarships available. Successful applicants are provisionally selected subject to the CSC agreeing terms of admission to the university.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Commonwealth PhD Scholarships are for full-time doctoral study at a UK university for applicants from least developed countries and vulnerable states in the Commonwealth. The CSC's work combines sustainable development with the UK national interest and provides opportunities for international partnerships and collaboration.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026/2027 Commonwealth PhD Scholarships are open from September 2, 2025, to October 14, 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded. Consists of full tuition fees (either Home or Overseas) plus a maintenance stipend during the research portion of the programme which increases each year with inflation. The scholarship also includes additional research costs of up to £1,200 per year for the stated duration of the research portion of the programme. Where students are undertaking integrated four-year doctoral programmes, the award will be extended to the 4th year of research.
covered_expenses: Additional research costs (up to £1,200 per year)

timeline_info.application_deadline: 9th January 2026 (for scholarship application documents); 23 November 2025 (for admission application for 2026-27 entry for some departments); 05-Jan-2026 13:00 UK time (another scholarship deadline mentioned)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to exceptional applicants from any country. Must be for a Postgraduate Scholarship. Applicants must have submitted a complete admission application to an eligible full- or part-time degree programme at UCL by the scholarship deadline, or currently be registered on an eligible full- or part-time eligible degree programme at UCL. Must be pursuing doctoral research (MPhil/PhD and EngD students).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Research degree programme (MPhil/PhD and EngD)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.2 or equivalent to a UK first-class degree in undergraduate studies.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate research degree (MPhil/PhD or EngD)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants must meet UCL's English language requirements. Examples include: IELTS: 6.5 overall (minimum 6.0 in each section); TOEFL: 92 overall. Other accepted qualifications include a minimum of 12 months of academic education in a country that UCL considers to be 'majority English speaking', or an English language qualification recognized by UCL (e.g., Cambridge O Level in English Language). For students on a Student Visa under an Erasmus agreement, B2 Level or higher is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: References must be submitted directly to your academic department by your referee by the scholarship deadline.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants do not need to have secured an offer of a place at UCL to apply for the scholarship, but must have submitted their complete UCL research degree application to UCL Admissions by the scholarship deadline.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Complete admission application to an eligible degree programme; Scholarship application documents; References.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates submit UCL-RES applications directly to the academic department they have applied to (or are currently enrolled in for current UCL PhD students). Departments nominate a research scholarship applicant.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The UCL Research Excellence Scholarship (UCL-RES) is the premier scholarship programme for exceptional scholars pursuing doctoral research at UCL.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship is offered for the 2026/27 academic year (and 2025/26). Admission application deadlines vary by department (e.g., 23 November 2025 for 2026-27 entry). Scholarship application documents and references have deadlines around early January 2026 (e.g., 9th January 2026, 05-Jan-2026).

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. The scholarship covers all fees and a stipend for two to three years, with over 300 Scholars in Residence in Oxford.

timeline_info.opening_date: Spring 2025 (for 2026 cycle); Early July (for US application availability)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 100 worldwide annually, including 32 from the United States.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to talented young people of diverse backgrounds, without regard to gender. Applicants must meet specific entry requirements for their chosen full-time graduate course at the University of Oxford. Completion of a bachelor's degree is required before admission to Oxford. Cannot apply if already on a postgraduate course at the University of Oxford to cover final years of current course. US applicants must be eligible through a state/territory of legal residence on April 15 in the year of application, or where they received at least two years of college training and a bachelor’s degree before October 1 in the year following election. Global applicants must meet language requirements by the deadline. Australian applicants (example for age/degree) must be under 27 on Oct 1, 2025 (born after Oct 1, 1998) and have completed their first undergraduate degree.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: No limitations on undergraduate major or field of study; scholars may pursue any of the varied fields available at the University of Oxford for master's or doctoral study. Postdoctoral awards are available in natural and physical science disciplines.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No official minimum GPA, but 3.7 is the usual minimum, and successful applicants for institutional endorsement often have 3.8 or higher. Some Oxford departments may have specific GPA requirements.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Completion of a first undergraduate degree is required before admission to Oxford. Applicants are typically in their final year of undergraduate or postgraduate studies, aiming for postgraduate study (Master's or Doctorate) at Oxford.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Demonstrated excellence and leadership in various areas (e.g., team captain, leading scorer).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants must meet the University of Oxford's language requirements.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required, strong and varied letters of recommendation are highly valued.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Required for DPhil applicants, outlining proposed research area and its contribution to future career plans.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 27 on October 1st of the application year (e.g., for 2025 application, born after October 1, 1998, based on Australian criteria).
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: None (selection is made without regard to gender).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Specific application processes for US citizens/lawful permanent residents, and for Global/Multi-jurisdictional/Inter-jurisdictional candidates.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: University endorsement is required. Highly recommended to contact Oxford degree programs/faculty. Requires a clear personal statement and a self-possessed interview.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Personal statement, letters of recommendation, outline of proposed research area (for DPhil applicants).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Includes university endorsement, a decentralized process for US applicants, and an interview.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: One of the oldest, most prestigious, and selective scholarships globally, enabling postgraduate study (Master's or Doctorate) at the University of Oxford. Scholars typically enter Oxford in October the year following election. Most US scholars pursue Master's or Doctorates, with some pursuing second B.A. degrees (Senior Status) to be completed within two years.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Undergraduate applicants should begin the process during their junior year. Scholars commence their program of study at Oxford in October of the year following their election.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship for international students. Provides a generous annual living stipend of AUD $36,063 (2025 rate) to assist with living costs during study. Tuition scholarships are available for international students and can be packaged with this stipend. Co-funded Monash Graduate Scholarships (CF-MGS) are provided by Monash University and co-funded by the enrolling faculty/academic unit.
covered_expenses: tuition fees (can be packaged with stipend)

timeline_info.application_deadline: International Round 1: 31 March 2025; International Round 3: 31 August 2025; Domestic Round 2: 31 March (implied 2025); Domestic Round 4: 31 October 2025

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to both domestic and international students undertaking Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees. International students must not hold Australian or New Zealand citizenship. Applicants must meet Monash's competitive scholarship selection process requirements, minimum admission (academic and English language proficiency) requirements, and visa requirements for international students. Also available to students undertaking Joint Research Awards when Monash University is the home institution.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields are part of the Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees offered at Monash University.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher (mentioned for CF-MGS, general MGS requires academic excellence)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees (Master’s and PhD programs)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: work experience, research experience, published papers

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Meet Monash English language proficiency requirements

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Meet Monash's competitive scholarship selection process requirements; Academic excellence; Meet minimum admission (academic and English language proficiency) and scholarship eligibility requirements; Meet visa requirements for international students.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Information about work experience and research experience; Letter of motivation; Publications of the candidate; Additional documents
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students are shortlisted based on academic excellence and competitive scholarship selection process requirements. Application for graduate research scholarships is done at the time of applying for your course unless already enrolled. The same application process is used for both admission and/or scholarship via the Applicant Portal. Applicants are automatically considered for all graduate research scholarships (where eligible) and do not need to specify which scholarship they are applying for.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Monash Graduate Scholarships (MGS) are provided by Monash University to support domestic and international students undertaking Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees. MGS provides a stipend to assist with living costs during study.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For international students, there are two rounds of application. Round 1 opens 1 September 2024 and closes 31 March 2025. International Round 3 deadline is 31 August 2025. Domestic Round 4 deadline is 31 October 2025.

basic_info.provider: British Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office and partner organizations

funding_info.funding_details: Paid directly to your university by Chevening, up to a pre-set cap.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: about 1,500 scholarships are awarded

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must meet eligibility criteria. Restrictions apply to employees, former employees, or relatives of employees of His Majesty’s Government (including the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office, all British Embassies/High Commissions, the Home Office, the Ministry of Defence, the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy, the Department for International Trade and the UKVI), the British Council, a sponsoring UK university, or a staff member of the Association of Commonwealth Universities, if the employment/affiliation was within the last two years from the opening of Chevening applications. Employees, former employees, or relatives of Chevening Partner organisations are eligible to apply, but if the employment took place within the last two years, you cannot receive a Chevening partner award from the organisation from which you work, previously worked, or are affiliated with through relatives.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Almost any field, including All, Arts & Humanities, Business, Education/Teaching, Public, politics, and a wide range of other fields.
field_restrictions.restrictions: The priority areas in which Scholarships are funded vary from country.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Applicants must have a bachelor's degree or equivalent to be eligible to apply for a one-year master's degree at a UK university.

experience_requirements.min_years: at least 2,800 hours of work experience (equivalent to two years full-time work)
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Full-time employment, Part-time employment, Voluntary work, Paid or unpaid, Self-employment

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: The Chevening language requirements are set by the UK universities applicants apply to, not by Chevening directly.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two references from people who can speak to your professional abilities, leadership potential, and suitability for the scholarship. These must be uploaded to the online application system or submitted to the local Chevening team by the end of the global interview period.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants need to reflect on their goals and values, create short, medium, and long-term plans, and be specific about how Chevening fits into their career plan. This is typically part of an essay.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants are required to select three course choices when applying for a Chevening Award. To be awarded a scholarship, an unconditional offer for one of the course choices must be secured by the deadline in the application timeline. Any Chevening-eligible course at any UK university can be chosen. Enrolling in a pre-sessional course to remove a condition of a university offer will make the award no longer tenable for that course. Evidence of an unconditional offer from one of the three course choices is needed to finalise the scholarship. It is not a requirement to apply to course choices before submitting the Chevening application. Applicants are identified as potential future leaders.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Essays (e.g., career plan, networking), course choices, work experience details, two reference letters.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The selection process is thorough and spans over eight months from the application deadline to final selection. Independent reading committees assess all eligible applications. Candidates are shortlisted for interviews. Interview results are announced from mid-June onwards. Successful applicants will be announced in June 2026 (for the 2026-27 cycle).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Chevening Scholarship is an international scholarship, funded by the British Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office and partner organizations. It is the UK Government’s prestigious international scholarships programme, allowing exceptional individuals to study for a one-year master's degree at a UK university.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The selection process takes at least 8 months from the application deadline. Interview results are announced from mid-June onwards, with successful applicants announced in June (e.g., June 2026 for the 2026-27 cycle) to commence UK studies.

basic_info.provider: Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR), Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC), and Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC) (Tri-Council agencies)

funding_info.funding_details: $40,000 per year for 36 months.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Directly to SSHRC: October 17, 2025 (8:00 p.m. eastern). Institutional deadlines vary, often significantly earlier (e.g., October 1, 2025 for Queen's University; September 15, 2025 for UAlberta internal review).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be registered in a U of T degree program at any time between January 1 - December 31 in the year of application, or on an approved leave of absence (for U of T specific). Eligibility has been expanded to include international students who are enrolled in a doctoral program of study at an eligible Canadian institution at the time of application (e.g., enrolled at Queen’s University by October 1, 2025). Applicants must be a Canadian citizen, a permanent resident of Canada or a Protected Person in Canada, OR an international student enrolled in a doctoral program at a Canadian institution. Applicants must have completed no more than 36 months of full-time study in their doctoral program by December 31 if transferred directly from a Bachelor's to a PhD or enrolled in a joint program (months counted from 1st registration). Applicants can submit a maximum of one Canada Graduate Research Scholarship – Master's (CGRS M), Canada Graduate Research Scholarship – Doctoral (CGRS D), or Canada Postdoctoral Research Award (CPRA) application per academic year to either CIHR, NSERC or SSHRC. Applicants may be not currently registered in a degree program but were registered at any other time during the calendar year of application in a degree program at a Canadian institution with a doctoral award quota for the selected agency, or not registered at any time during the calendar year of application in a degree program at a Canadian institution with a doctoral award quota for the selected agency (in which case they may apply directly to the agency).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All academic disciplines (across Tri-Council agencies). Specifically, natural sciences or engineering for NSERC.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Proposed research must fall under the correct agency’s mandate (CIHR, NSERC, or SSHRC).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Competitive GPA for NSERC CGS-D is around a 3.6 and above.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Doctoral program (or direct transfer from Bachelor's to PhD).

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students who studied part-time or interrupted their doctoral studies must contact GPS Award Services by September 5, 2025 to request an ‘Official letter to confirm part-time study and/or leave of absence’.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Dedicate full attention to research activities. Complete the appropriate agency’s online application form. Complete the Common CV. Confirm all required transcripts have been provided. Follow detailed instructions on agency websites regarding application completion, agency mandate alignment, number of referees, and presentation standards for free-form documents.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Appropriate agency’s online application form (e.g., Doctoral Research Award form for CIHR, Doctoral Awards Form for SSHRC), Common CV, Official transcripts (scanned copies of official transcripts, or via specific transcript request forms), Official letter to confirm part-time study and/or leave of absence (if applicable).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are first reviewed and ranked by the applicant's graduate program at their institution. Institutions have quotas for the number of applications they can submit to the national competition. University review and adjudication takes place.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Canada Graduate Research Scholarship—Doctoral program (also referred to as CGS-D) is a federal program of scholarships awarded through national competitions by CIHR, NSERC, and SSHRC. It recognizes and supports outstanding innovators, knowledge workers, creative thinkers, and researchers, fostering impacts within and beyond the research environment by providing support for a high-quality research training experience.

basic_info.provider: UK Research and Innovation (UKRI), including councils such as AHRC, EPSRC, ESRC, MRC, NERC, STFC.

funding_info.funding_details: Doctoral training grants provided to UK universities and consortia of Research Organisations to support AHRC-funded studentships and multiple studentships across various fields. These are flexible awards for doctoral study, offering high-quality and coherent postgraduate training. Fully-funded UKRI studentships are available.
covered_expenses: UK tuition fees (maximum £4,786 each year, or £5,006 each year for some cases)
Stipend at UK Research and Innovation (UKRI) rate
Research Support Training Grant (RTSG) / Research training support grant (£1,000 each year)
Difference between Home fees and International fees (covered by some DTPs, e.g., University of Edinburgh for E5 DTP International applicants)

timeline_info.application_deadline: Deadlines vary significantly by individual DTP. Examples include: November 18, 2025, 8:00 PM ET (for one opportunity); January 17, 2025 (for Techne DTP); January 16, 2025 (for MRC stage two round seven); early January (for CENTA applications starting in October). Prospective students must contact the relevant DTP directly for specific closing dates.
timeline_info.opening_date: Opening dates vary by individual DTP. Examples include: November 1, 2024 (for MRC stage two round seven); January 21, 2026, 3:00 PM (for International Placement Scheme 2026, potentially related).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies by DTP. Examples include: at least 13 funded postgraduate studentships (IAPETUS2 for 2026 cohort); 45 studentships (for a specific DTP, consisting of 5 standard and 4 iCASE studentships per year). International studentships are capped by UKRI at 30% of the total number of studentships awarded each year by a DTP. Up to 15 Vacation Internships per year can also be awarded from a university's DTP funding.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: UKRI studentships are open to international students from the 2021-22 academic year onwards, including EU applicants. Applicants from all citizenships and fee statuses are eligible, provided they meet the PhD entry requirements set by the host university/DTP. To be classed as a home student, applicants must be a UK National (meeting residency requirements) or have settled status. Candidates not meeting these criteria are treated as international students. Prospective students must apply directly to a DTP or CDT, and each one will decide which students are eligible for funding, following UK government regulations for residential eligibility.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Varies by DTP and funding council. Includes: the full range of the social sciences (ESRC), Arts and Humanities (AHRC). Other fields covered by UKRI councils (EPSRC, MRC, NERC, STFC) are implied.
field_restrictions.restrictions: International studentships are capped by UKRI at 30% of the total number of studentships awarded each year by a DTP.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: First or upper second class honours degree level
academic_requirements.required_degree: Honours degree at a first or upper second class level, or a masters from a UK academic research organisation. Applicants must also meet the PhD entry requirements set by the specific university/DTP.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience and employment history for the last 3 years are considered during the application process.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English Language Test results are not necessarily required at the time of application, but if not provided by the interview stage, only a conditional funding offer may be issued.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must meet the PhD entry requirements set by the specific university/DTP.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application may require employment history for the last 3 years and any relevant work experience (maximum 7000 characters with spaces). English Language Test results may be required by the interview stage.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Prospective students must apply directly to a DTP or CDT. Each DTP/CDT has strict internal processes for selecting students and deciding eligibility for funding, following UK government regulations for residential eligibility. Recruitment processes vary by DTP.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: UKRI Doctoral Training Partnerships (DTPs) provide high-quality and coherent postgraduate training through flexible awards to support doctoral studentships. The duration for some DTPs is 3.5 years (or part-time equivalent).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Start dates for studentships often occur in October (e.g., October 1, 2025 for Techne DTP, October 2024 for a NERC cohort). Program dates for one opportunity are Summer 2026. Duration is typically 3.5 years (or part-time equivalent).

basic_info.official_name: FWO PhD fellowships fundamental research and strategic basic research

funding_info.funding_details: EUR 2,460 per month + other benefits.
covered_expenses: Research costs (bench fee) of €3,720 per year for PhD fellows.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 492 new PhD fellows (fundamental research and strategic basic research combined) in a past call.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Supports researchers who have recently graduated and aim to pursue an independent PhD fundamental research project. Applicants must have a Master's degree. If older than 31 years old on October 1, the Master's degree must have been obtained no longer than 5 years previously.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Fundamental research, Strategic basic research

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree

additional_requirements.age_limits: If older than 31 years old on October 1, the Master's degree must have been obtained no longer than 5 years previously.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Aim to pursue an independent PhD fundamental research project.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Includes (online) preselection meetings (12-27 June 2025). Results are announced by the Board of Trustees of FWO.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A PhD Fellowship allows young researchers to prepare a PhD and develop into independent researchers. It supports early-stage researchers.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Call opens: 5 December 2024. Application deadline: 3 March 2025 (5 PM CET). Preselection meetings: 12-27 June 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded (stipend, tuition, flight fee). PhD and Research scholarship: CHF 1920/month for 1 year, renewable for up to 3 years (conditional upon excellent performance). A professor hosting an FCS scholarship holder at a USI institute may decide to top up the scholarship with a part-time job appointment, funded by the institute's doctoral funding resources.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Aimed at young researchers from abroad who have completed a master’s degree or PhD. Open to international students. Applicants who have already benefited from a Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship are not eligible to apply for a second scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Research Scholarships for postgraduate research in the realm of their PhD at all Swiss cantonal universities, universities of applied sciences, the two federal institutes of technology, and four research institutes. Research or a Ph.D. degree program in all disciplines.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree (for PhD applicants)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applicants must demonstrate proficiency in language.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Some scholarships may require nomination by the Swiss university. Candidates are responsible for arranging their own affiliations with a host professor who is willing to supervise their research at a Swiss public university, Federal Institute of Technology, University of Applied Sciences, or School of Music and Arts.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Academic Excellence

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Awarded by the Federal Commission for Scholarships for Foreign Students (FCS) based on academic achievements.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Each year the Swiss Confederation awards Government Excellence Scholarships to encourage international exchange and research cooperation between Switzerland and over 180 other countries. These are prestigious and fully funded opportunities in Europe, offering the opportunity to study at renowned Swiss universities. The scholarship start date is 1 September.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The 2026-2027 Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship Program is the current focus.

funding_info.funding_details: Provides a competitive salary, research funds (up to CHF 3,000/year), and conference funds (up to CHF 5,000/year) for four years, with a possible one-year extension. The salary contribution is determined by the salary scale linked to the applicant’s job at the host institution.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Several

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to citizens of any nationality. No age restrictions apply. Applicants must be enrolled in a doctoral program at a Swiss institution, or accepted into a Swiss doctoral program before the final application deadline, with the endorsement of a professor at that institution. Study level is Doctoral.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Cyber-defence research

academic_requirements.required_degree: Enrollment in a doctoral program at a Swiss institution

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Strong alignment with the program’s research mission and a compelling research proposal are key to success. Primary evaluation criterion is excellence, assessed through academic records and professional accomplishments. Endorsement of a professor at a Swiss institution is required.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Primary evaluation criterion is excellence, assessed through academic records and professional accomplishments. Strong alignment with the program’s research mission and a compelling research proposal are key to success.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The CYD Doctoral Fellowships are a talent program for cyber-defence research, enabling fellows to complete their PhD thesis at the CYD Campus. They provide salary, research, and conference funds for four years, with a possible one-year extension.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The 13th call will open on 3 December 2025, with a submission deadline for Stage 1 on 25 February 2026 (17:00 CET). A general application deadline of 20 August 2025 is also mentioned.

basic_info.official_name: DAAD Doctoral Programmes in Germany (Research Grants)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully-funded financial support. Doctoral candidates receive 1,200 euros per month.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from specified countries of origin (including those from the United States and Canada). Open to PhD students, Post-Docs, and highly qualified doctoral candidates who are early in their academic/professional careers or individuals wishing to earn a doctoral degree in Germany. Also for those doing their doctorate at a university or research institution outside Germany or who have already completed their doctorate (post-doc).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: various levels and fields, including STEM

academic_requirements.required_degree: Enrolled in a doctoral programme or have completed a master's degree.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Advisor/recommender should send the signed reference form via email or mail to the DAAD New York office.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Application details vary from country to country. For most scholarships, you must apply separately to the university or research institution in Germany; submitting a DAAD scholarship application does not automatically mean you’re applying to a study or research program. The stay abroad (in Germany) must be a required part of the curriculum of the study program and should not be conducted in the home country. Nominated by the professor supervising their research project (for some grants).

background_and_logistics.official_website: DAAD portal (accessible through the scholarship database)
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Some documents need to be sent separately by post. Print a copy of your DAAD application materials.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection takes place in May 2026. The funding period will be determined by the selection committee during the selection process, taking your work schedule into account.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: DAAD funding is one of the most popular scholarships that helps international students and researchers turn their dream of studying or doing research in Germany into reality. Offers research grants for PhD candidates and other grants for various levels and fields.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications opened Oct 31, 2025 for the 2026 cohort. Funding must begin in 2026, with a specific start from August 2026 mentioned. The scholarship cannot be extended.

funding_info.funding_details: Full financial support for four years, including maintenance stipend and university tuition fees. Specific amounts and tuition coverage (e.g., home/EU rate vs. international) may vary by programme and nationality. £80,000 for UK funding for Wellcome Trust-NIH scheme.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 10 February 2026 (for Doctoral programmes for healthcare professionals); November 28, 2024 (09:00 GMT) for Wellcome Sanger Institute 2024 entry; November 26, 2025 (09:00 Europe/London) for Wellcome Sanger Institute 2026 entry.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now open for October 2026 entry (King's PhD Programme in Mental Health Research).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Twelve fully funded four-year PhD studentships available from October 2026 (Wellcome Sanger Institute); 39 Wellcome Trust-NIH PhD scholarships awarded in the last eight years; two 4-year PhD programmes awarded to Edinburgh Infectious Diseases.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Graduates or students who have, or expect to obtain, a degree (or equivalent for EU and overseas candidates) in a relevant subject. Candidates with other relevant qualifications or research experience may also be eligible. Applicants from the UK and EU are eligible for a studentship that includes a maintenance stipend and tuition fees paid in full at the home/EU rate. Full financial support including University tuition fees is available regardless of nationality for some programmes (e.g., Wellcome Sanger Institute). Cannot apply to carry out activities that involve the transfer of grant funds into mainland China.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Science, Mental Health Research, Infectious Diseases, Hosts, Pathogens and Global Health, Integrative Infection Biology, quantitative aspects of biological research.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Cannot apply to carry out activities that involve the transfer of grant funds into mainland China.

academic_requirements.required_degree: A degree (or equivalent for EU and overseas candidates) in a relevant subject.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Research experience.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Referees should state applicant's name and the Wellcome Trust 4-year PhD programme on the reference letter, as well as how they know the applicant and for how long.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: A key aim of the Dundee programme is to have graduates who are data literate and skilled in the quantitative aspects of biological research.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Funds PhD programmes that offer graduates outstanding training in scientific research, providing broad, interdisciplinary training. Programmes include cohort building activities and career development.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Duration of funding: 4 years.

basic_info.provider: Spanish Ministry of Education and/or Ministry of Science and Innovation (Government of Spain)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded for a maximum duration of four years. Annual funding amounts increase over time.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by call/institution. Specific deadlines mentioned: 26 January 2023 (for 2022 FPI), 30 November 2023 (for FPI), 15 November 2025 (for Research Training Grants Programme), 26 January (for a 4-year FPI grant).
timeline_info.opening_date: Varies by call/institution. Specific opening date mentioned: 1 October 2025 (for Research Training Grants Programme).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 800 grants (for FPU program)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Aimed at the training of PhD students by funding predoctoral contracts. Candidates must hold a Bachelor's degree and a Master's degree in a relevant field. Proven interest or background in research is required. FPU grants are for university teacher training, enabling candidates to obtain a PhD and acquire university teaching skills. A minimum average grade of the academic transcript is required.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All areas of scientific research may be eligible for funding. Specific examples include cardiovascular medicine, endocrinology, and oncology.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree and a Master's degree (as prerequisite for doctoral programs)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Proven interest or background in research

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must not hold a PhD degree. Must not have held similar predoctoral funding exceeding 12 months prior to the deadline. Students already hired for longer than one year as PhD students holding a 'Predoctoral' training contract are not eligible. Thesis supervisors must be in possession of a doctoral thesis and have a contractual relationship.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcript. Necessary documentation to sign the contract (after acceptance).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The final selection will take place (details not provided).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The FPI/FPU Predoctoral Grants are Spanish Government scholarships designed to promote research and higher education by funding predoctoral contracts for the training of PhD students. The FPI (Formación de Personal Investigador) grants are for predoctoral contracts for the training of doctors. The FPU (Formación de Profesorado Universitario) grants are for university teacher training, enabling candidates to obtain a PhD and acquire university teaching skills. These are distinguished financial aid initiatives intended to lessen financial barriers, honor academic achievement, and promote creativity in Spanish research institutes and universities.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadline varies. The funding has a maximum duration of four years.

funding_info.funding_details: The purpose of the FRIA scholarship is to complete a PhD in 4 years in fields of research related to industry or agriculture. New scale for FRIA and FRESH Doctoral Grant: 1st scholarship: 27.836, 40 € (gross annual); 2nd scholarship: 29.158, 56 € (gross annual).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be PhD students with a fully paid affiliation at a Belgian University at the deadline of the call and when leaving for the research stay. No applicant may apply for a FRIA Grant if they successively received two Research Fellow fellowships (ASP. + ASP-REN) of the F.R.S.-FNRS or two FRESH grants.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: fields of research related to industry or agriculture (for FRIA)

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Only one application for a Research Fellow (ASP) is allowed.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online Submission: via the FNRS e-space portal. Call Text & Guidelines. Applicants to F.R.S.-FNRS funding must submit an administrative application on e-space. Appendices (see section 2.1).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The F.R.S.-FNRS employs over 2,000 researchers at different stages in their careers. This covers: either grants or fixed term contracts, for doctoral or. The purpose of the FRIA scholarship is to complete a PhD in 4 years.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The Grants and Fellowships Call is opened once a year and is published on the F.R.S.-FNRS website. Once the call is open, the key dates will be posted on the FNRS website (www.frs-fnrs.be/en/calendrier-des-appels).

basic_info.official_name: Government of Ireland Postgraduate Scholarship Programme
basic_info.provider: Irish Research Council (IRC), Department of Further and Higher Education, Research, Innovation and Science, Taighde Éireann/Research Ireland

funding_info.funding_details: Provides an annual stipend of €25,000, covers tuition fees (including non-EU fees) up to €5,750 per year (with an additional €4,000 possible), and offers €3,250 annually for eligible direct research expenses. The total award can be up to €34,000 per annum.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Hundreds of awards are given annually

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding students from all countries (international students) pursuing research-based master's and doctoral degrees at Irish institutions. Supports exceptional research master's or doctoral candidates from any country. Open to all nationalities worldwide.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All academic disciplines

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Applicants must normally have a first-class or upper second-class honours bachelor's degree (or equivalent). Equivalents mentioned include a minimum GPA of 3.0–3.5 (65–75%), above 3.7 (80%) for fully funded, 4.0 grade point average scale, or 5.0 to 5.49 on a 7-point scale.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Research-based Master's or Doctoral (PhD) degrees

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Extensive experience (for candidates with a 2.2 honours degree)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters (independent of proposed supervisor) are required.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Secure a letter of support from a supervisor at an eligible Irish institution. Supervisor Deadline: 6 November 2025. Research Office Endorsement: 13 November 2025.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Applicant form (e.g., GOIPG_2025_Applicant-form.docx), 2 recommendation letters, letter of support from a supervisor.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Highly competitive, with an average success rate of 18% over the past five years.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: An established national initiative, unique in the Irish research landscape, complementing other channels for funded postgraduate education. Emphasizes excellence in research. Funded by the Department of Further and Higher Education, Research, Innovation and Science, and managed by the Council (Taighde Éireann/Research Ireland).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are now open for the 2026 Government of Ireland Postgraduate Scholarship Programme.

basic_info.provider: Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, including a grant of EUR 9,000 per year (or total, disbursed in three instalments), full tuition waiver/exemption, and health insurance.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Multiple

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign students not residing in Italy and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in an Italian University/Institute and meet the entry requirements established by the University. PhD and research programs are eligible. Both international and local students are eligible, provided they meet academic, age, and language criteria.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's Degree programs, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs, Italian Language and Culture advanced courses, PhD programs, and research/training programs.
field_restrictions.restrictions: The grant is incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree for postgraduate courses, or appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in the Italian University/Institute. For PhD, applicants need to meet university entry requirements and academic qualifications.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Italian-taught courses, a B2 level in Italian (CEFR) is required. For English-taught courses, a B2 level in English is required. A certificate of proficiency is needed. University-issued language certification may be accepted. One source mentions A2 level (CEFR) for Italian language.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Minimum 18 years old. Not over 28 years old for Master's, AFAM, and Italian Language & Culture courses (with specific birthdate cutoffs mentioned, e.g., born after May 16, 1996 or June 9, 1994, depending on the call year). Not over 30 years old for PhD programs. Exceptions for renewals.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: PhD applicants are required to provide a letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University. The scholarship can be renewed for the following academic year if students meet performance requirements.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Applicants must prepare and submit a set of documents. Required documents include a letter of acceptance from the Italian University (for PhD programs) and a certificate of Italian language proficiency (for Italian-taught courses).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship promotes cooperation in cultural, scientific, and technological fields, supporting international students studying, training, or doing research work in Italian universities. It provides financial and academic support, making higher education in Italy more accessible. Scholarships are awarded annually.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The application deadline for the 2025-2026 academic year is May 15, 2025, 2 pm CET.

basic_info.provider: French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs (developer/funder), Campus France (manager)

funding_info.funding_details: Provides a monthly allowance/stipend, travel and housing assistance. Tuition fees are not covered. Only those parts of the study program occurring in France are funded by the scholarship, except for certain internship or exchange periods.

timeline_info.application_deadline: January 8, 2026 (for French higher education institutions to submit applications to Campus France). Institutional deadlines vary, e.g., November 17, 2025 (for TSM).
timeline_info.opening_date: October 2025 (general opening of application period for 2026-2027 session). E.g., October 27, 2025 (for TSM).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Approximately 350 scholarships are awarded each year (total for Master's and PhD). A few years ago, 70 scholarships were awarded to PhD students.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Exclusively for French higher education institutions to attract the best international students to master's and doctoral degree programs. Students must be nominated by a French higher education institution and accepted into a program in order to be eligible. Applications are submitted exclusively by French higher education institutions. Only candidates applying for the first time at the PhD level and from one educational institution are eligible. Should not benefit from another French government scholarship at the time of the application deadline.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Science and techniques: Biology and health, Ecological transition, Mathematics and digital, Science and engineering; Human and social sciences: French history, language and civilization, Law and political sciences, Economics and management.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Grade point average above 15/20 (scholarshipunion.com). Note: Some sources state no specific GPA thresholds publicly stated, with selection hinging on portfolio quality, Olympiad performance, and interviews (dreamdegreeabroad.com).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree (implied for PhD application).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English B2 (IELTS 5.5+/TOEFL 72+)

additional_requirements.age_limits: For Doctorate program: Must be under the age of 32 (Brown University). Foreign PhD students aged 35 or under (born after March 31st 1990) for the first year of a co-supervised or co-directed thesis (U-Paris). International PhD student born after March 31st 1993 (Universite Paris-Saclay).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: The 36-month scholarship is conditional on enrolment in the 1st year of PhD and for newcomers students only, and cannot be used to sign a cotutelle agreement.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Should not benefit from another French government scholarship at the time of the application deadline.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection hinges on portfolio quality, Olympiad performance, and interviews.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Eiffel Excellence Scholarship Program supports students from universities around the world in pursuing graduate studies at French higher education institutions. Awarded for research stays for 12, 18 or 36 months in France.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Duration: 12 to 36 months, depending on graduate program.

basic_info.official_name: Siemens China Scholarship at Tsinghua University
basic_info.provider: Siemens Ltd., China (in partnership with Tsinghua University)

funding_info.funding_details: Full scholarship, valued at approximately 25,000 Euro annually.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Multiple scholarships

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding international students of any nationality, specifically PhD candidates, who have not received any other award from Tsinghua University.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Future of Automation, Autonomous Robotics

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.3/4 or B+ or 85/100 (Undergraduate GPA)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree (required for PhD program)

additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 35 years for PhD program (general requirement for PhD in China)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Scholarship recipients must apply for their own accommodation and purchase comprehensive medical insurance upon registration.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application Form for Siemens China Scholarship (downloadable from https://yzbm.tsinghua.edu.cn/intlLogin/b/yzlxs/yz_sys_xxfjb/download/file?id=206522)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarship recipients list expected to be published in the Application for Graduate Admission (https://yzbm.tsinghua.edu.cn/intlLogin) in the middle of 2026.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Siemens China Scholarship at Tsinghua University is a full scholarship offered by Siemens Ltd., China to support outstanding international students for PhD studies in fields such as Artificial Intelligence, Future of Automation, Autonomous Robotics. It provides about 25k Euro full scholarship every year.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadline is February 28, 2025. Scholarship recipients are expected to be published in mid-2026.

basic_info.study_country: Canada (for enrollment), developing countries (for field research)

funding_info.funding_details: 25 awards of up to CA$20,000 each.
covered_expenses: one return trip from Canada to the developing country

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be enrolled in a doctoral program at a Canadian university pursuing their first PhD. Open to Canadian citizens, permanent residents of Canada, and citizens of developing countries pursuing doctoral studies at a Canadian university. Intended for advanced doctoral students who intend to conduct their field research in one or more developing countries.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Climate-Resilient Food Systems, Democratic and Inclusive Governance, Education and Science, Global Health, Sustainable Inclusive Economies, international development.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.5 or higher
academic_requirements.required_degree: Doctoral program (first PhD)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: record of research excellence

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Nationally recognized ethics bodies/committees in the Global South (e.g., University Institutional Review Board (IRB), National Council for Science and Technology, National government ministry) may be required.

background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The International Doctoral Research Awards (IDRA) aim to strengthen the research capacity of doctoral students enrolled at Canadian universities. They promote the growth of Canadian and developing-country capacity in research to improve the lives of people. The awards support doctoral students conducting field research in developing countries.

funding_info.funding_details: All successful HEC PhD students receive a full tuition fee waiver and a cost-of-living scholarship of €26,000 per year for 5 years, funded by the HEC Foundation. Additional financial support includes conference funding, research project funding, return ticket, visa fees, and mandatory health insurance.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 11 March 2024 (Round 2); 18 December 2024 (for Sept 2025 intake); 22 April 2025 (for Sept 2025 intake); 18 December 2025 (preferred, Round One for 2026 intake); 2 January 2026 (final, Round One for 2026 intake)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to all nationalities. Applicants must show a clear ambition to become top researchers in international academic institutions. Must hold a university degree (Bachelor or Master).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Management, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Strategy, ISOM, Marketing, HR, and Law and Regulation

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor or Master

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Report cards and GPA for your 10th and 12th grades
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The HEC Paris PhD Program offers comprehensive funding including a full tuition fee waiver, a €26,000/year cost-of-living scholarship for 5 years, conference and research project funding, return ticket, visa fees, and mandatory health insurance.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadlines vary by round and intake, including 11 March 2024 (Round 2), 18 December 2024, 22 April 2025 (for Sept 2025 intake), and 18 December 2025 / 2 January 2026 (for 2026 intake). Applications for the 2026 intake open on July 1, 2025.

basic_info.official_name: Aga Khan Foundation International Scholarship Programme (AKF-ISP)

funding_info.funding_details: AKF ISP awards are structured as half grant and half loan – where you need to repay 50 percent of the award amount. Scholarships are awarded on a 50% grant : 50% loan basis.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: a limited number of scholarships each year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding scholars from selected countries who have no other means of financing their studies, to pursue postgraduate education. Applicants must be from Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Egypt, India, Kenya, Kyrgyz Republic, Madagascar, Mozambique, Pakistan, Syria, Tajikistan, Tanzania, and Uganda. For study in France, Portugal, UK, USA and Canada, applications are accepted from those who are originally from one of the above developing countries. Must demonstrate good academic standing and ongoing financial need during the postgraduate programme. Expected to prepare for employment, primarily within the AKDN.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate education (Master’s or PhD). Scholarships for Master’s studies are granted for the entire duration of the degree course. For PhD students, scholarships are awarded for the first two years, after which funding from alternative sources is expected.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Applicants are expected to have some years of work experience in their field of interest.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Prepare for employment, primarily within the AKDN.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Must have no other means of financing their studies.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Demonstrate good academic standing and ongoing financial need during the course of your postgraduate programme.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Official AKF Scholarship Application Form
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Competitive application process. Awards are made once a year in June or July.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Opportunity for outstanding scholars from selected countries to develop effective scholars and leaders.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships for Master’s studies cover the entire degree duration. For PhD students, scholarships cover the first two years. Awards are made annually in June or July.

funding_info.funding_details: Annual stipend varies by program, ranging from €19,000 to €25,000 per annum. Specific scholarships mentioned include: €19,000 per annum (National Centre for Family Business/DCU Business School), €25,000 per annum (School of History and Geography, School of Communications, English), and €22,000 per annum (DCU Business School EI PhD Scholarship). Some stipends are tax-free.
covered_expenses: up to €5,000 to support research activity

timeline_info.application_deadline: Multiple deadlines exist depending on the specific school/program: Tuesday 18th March 2025, 17:00 Irish time (SALIS); 28 March 2025 (English, general); 31 March 2025 (School of Communications).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies by program: 1 (DCU Business School EI PhD Scholarship), 2 (School of Communications).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to EU & non-EU applicants. Successful candidates are expected to be resident in the Dublin region for the duration of their studies. Applicants need a relevant degree and must meet DCU Entry Requirements. English language requirements apply for non-native speakers.

Doctoral Networks can last for up to 4 years (up to 5 years for Joint Doctorate projects). Fellowship durations for individual researchers range from 3-36 months (standard/industrial) to 3-48 months (joint doctorates). Three funding modalities are offered, with specific incentives for Industrial and Joint Doctoral Networks.
