additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants may explain any gaps in the chronology of their experience, but are not required to justify circumstances when noting considerations.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Strong research proposal. Applicants should confirm eligibility and apply to a university on the Vanier Scholarship Universities list.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic work must be submitted, including a strong research proposal.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Vanier CGS nominees are evaluated by agency-specific multidisciplinary peer review committees. The Tri-Agencies (CIHR, NSERC and SSHRC) have harmonized their post-award policies for research training programs. The program implements a ban on any form of public announcement until the Federal government makes the annual public funding announcement.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Vanier Canada Graduate Scholarships (Vanier CGS) is a highly competitive, fully funded scholarship offered by the Government of Canada for PhD degree students, launched in 2008. It aims to attract and retain world-class doctoral students and establish Canada as a global centre of excellence in research and higher learning. The current competition (with results released in mid-April 2025) will be the final one for this program. It is named after Georges Philias Vanier.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applicants should plan their university application one year ahead of their planned start date. Results are released in mid-April.

basic_info.provider: King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship for international students, providing full free tuition support, annual living allowance up to $30,000 (or USD 38,000 annual living allowance), on-campus housing, medical and dental coverage, and relocation support. A comprehensive KAUST Fellowship is awarded to every student admitted to a master's or PhD program, supporting students for the duration of their graduate studies.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Hundreds of fully funded scholarships are awarded each year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available for international students admitted to a PhD program at KAUST. Every admitted student to a master's or PhD's program earns the KAUST fellowship, with no exception.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Research areas aligned with KAUST's priorities in food and health, water, energy, environment, and the digital domain.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree or Bachelor's degree with research experience (for direct PhD application)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Research experience, job experience

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Minimum TOEFL score of 81 on the IBT (Internet Based Test) or 6.5 on the IELTS (International English Language Testing System). IELTS requires 5.5 in all individual sections; TOEFL iBT requires 17 in all individual sections. Not required if the applicant received a degree from an accredited institution in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Ireland, Australia, or New Zealand. KAUST does not require the GRE exam for admission. KAUST admissions code for TOEFL is 4107.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants applying with a Bachelor's degree should have research experience and contact a professor before applying.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CV, proposed research proposal, document including job experience, research experience, and other relevant information.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Consideration of: Scientific achievements (quality, originality, output of research, ability to carry out independent research, future potential based on reference letters, previous awards/scholarships, unique attributes/contributions). Proposed Research Projects (scientific quality, approach, novelty, significance, relevance to KAUST priorities, dissemination, feasibility, work plan quality, budget practicality, potential for innovation). Host PI suitability (suitability of host PI and research lab for proposed research and applicant's background).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 2009, King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST) is a graduate research university devoted to finding solutions for pressing scientific and technological challenges. The KAUST Fellowship is awarded to every student admitted to a graduate program and supports students for the duration of their studies.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: PhD at KAUST takes a minimum of 2.5 years. An MS/PhD combined program is around 5 years. Students can leave after 2 years with a Master's degree.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded
covered_expenses: Monthly stipend (1,800 TL (~$180 USD) for PhD)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: over 5,000 scholarships this year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from all nationalities. Designed for outstanding international candidates. Individuals who are currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education they will apply for are eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Engineering, health, social sciences, natural sciences, humanities and fine arts

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.00/4.00; Min. 90 (on another scale)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Hold a relevant master's degree or its equivalent; graduate of a Master's degree program (with thesis) from related fields

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Experience in Research for PhD programs is required

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English proficiency required, with specific scores mentioned as Min. 500 and Min. 153 (likely TOEFL PBT/CBT equivalents)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Usually 1 or 2 reference letters, some universities may request up to 3 for graduate programs
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under the age of 35 for PhD programs
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Thesis sample required for Master's or PhD degree applicants. Clarity of purpose and determination. Outstanding academic record.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online Turkish Scholarships application form, thesis sample, reference letters, other documents to be prepared
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Application completed entirely online through the official portal. Interviews are usually held at Turkish embassies or consulates in each applicant’s home country. Shortlisted applicants may be nominated by universities (e.g., Koç University) for funding.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Government-funded and competitive scholarship program launched in 2012, administered by the Government of Turkey. Provides international students with opportunities to pursue undergraduate, master’s, doctoral, and research studies at top Turkish universities. It is a comprehensive program offering full-time and short-term education opportunities. Highly competitive, with over 250,000 applications submitted for the 2024/2025 cycle. PhD program duration is 4-5 years with dissertation.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for 2025 are closed. The 2026-27 cycle is opening soon, with a deadline of February 20, 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Mostly part-cost awards. Some specific partnership programs (e.g., UCA-Cambridge Trust) offer full tuition and an annual stipend for living expenses. A Facebook post also mentioned full tuition, £21,000 allowance, free air travel, and visa cost for a specific context.
covered_expenses: Annual stipend/allowance for living expenses (for some awards)
Fieldwork maintenance allowance (for PhD, for some awards like Gates Cambridge)

timeline_info.application_deadline: Course-dependent, aligning with University of Cambridge postgraduate application funding deadlines. Specific dates mentioned for 2026/27 entry include: 15 October 2025 (US round for Gates Cambridge), 2 December 2025 or 7 January 2026 (International rounds for Gates Cambridge and UCA-Cambridge Trust). The UCA scholarship component has a deadline of 16 November 2025.
timeline_info.opening_date: Early September 2025 (for 2026/27 cycle, based on Gates Cambridge)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Around 500-600 scholarships annually by the Cambridge Trust (for all awards, not specific to international PhD). Gates Cambridge offers c.80-95 full-cost scholarships annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to applicants from countries other than the United Kingdom or Ireland. Applicants must be highly ranked by their prospective Departments within the University. No restriction on scholars receiving awards for further courses of study.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any subject available at the University of Cambridge.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate degree (primarily PhD, but also MPhil, Master, and potentially short courses).

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: For the UCA-Cambridge Trust partnership, recipients will be offered an employment arrangement with UCA or another appropriate role within AKDN, which includes an agreed-upon teaching, research, or professional contribution following the completion of their studies.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants should demonstrate an outstanding academic record and intellectual distinction. They must be able to argue for their selected graduate programs and why they must pursue that training at the University of Cambridge. They should show relevant and advanced coursework affirming commitment to their chosen field (qualities mentioned for Gates Cambridge, but generally applicable for highly ranked applicants).

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants are automatically considered based on their application for admission to the University of Cambridge and are highly ranked by their prospective Departments within the University. For the UCA-Cambridge Trust partnership, applications are reviewed by the UCA selection committee, and shortlisted candidates will be invited to apply to the University of Cambridge.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Cambridge Trust International Scholarships are offered to international students undertaking postgraduate studies at the University of Cambridge. No separate application is required; applicants are automatically considered based on their application for admission to the University of Cambridge, submitted by the course-specific funding deadline.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The 2025/26 scholarship round has ended. Scholarships are available for courses starting in 2026/27.
